fields.description: We look at the Lorenz '96 model, which involves the coupling of fast-time and slow-time oscillators resulting in chaotic dynamics. We examine how the number of fast- and slow-oscillators effects the dynamics. For particular parameter choices, we find the existence of standing waves despite the expectation of a chaotic attractor.
fields.title: Dimensional Analyses of the Lorenz '96 Model

fields.description: We investigate the relationship between how people move around and how happy they are using Twitter. In addition, we add to the characterization of the shape of human mobility in general.
fields.title: Human Mobility and Happiness on Twitter

fields.description: We conduct a detailed investigation of correlations between real-time expressions of individualsmade across the United States and a wide range of emotional, geographic, demographic, and healthcharacteristics.
fields.title: The Geography of Happiness

fields.description: We use an evolutionary algorithm to train a predictor capable of identifying the most likely links in the next time step of a social network changing over time.
fields.title: Link Prediction on Dynamic Networks

fields.description: We investigate the geo-spatial patterns regarding the use of profanity in the United States.
fields.title: GeoProfanity

fields.description: Executing search tasks using real people by utilizing the small-world characteristics observed in social networks.
fields.title: Social search and the Small-World Phenomenon

fields.description: Now Online: The Dow Jones Index of Happiness
fields.title: hedonometer.org
